byline.contributor: Eric Lichtblau contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Chicago officials release video of fatal police shooting of black man Ronald Johnson from October 2014, in wake of criticism over video of shooting death of Laquan McDonald in same month; Cook County will not bring charges against Office George Hernandez in shooting of Johnson, citing evidence he was armed; despite elaborate presentation designed to show how Johnson was clear threat, city officials continue to face public pressure and distrust.
lead_paragraph: The announcement followed several weeks of uproar in Chicago over charges for another officer in a separate shooting death, of Laquan McDonald.

headline.main: No Charges for Chicago Officer in 2014 Shooting of Ronald Johnson
headline.print_headline: Another Video From Chicago, but No Charges

snippet: The announcement followed several weeks of uproar in Chicago over charges for another officer in a separate shooting death, of Laquan McDonald.
